69 2021-02-03 throat swelling Anaphylactic shock; Potassium "dropped to 1%"; Cold and numb sensation; Sweating; Chest pressure; Bl... Read more
Close
Anaphylactic shock; Potassium "dropped to 1%"; Cold and numb sensation; Sweating; Chest pressure; Blood pressure was 223/105-110; Neck swelling; Numb lips; Throat swelling; Disability NOS; A spontaneous report was received from a 69-year-old, female, patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 Vaccine (mRNA-1273), and experienced anaphylactic shock, potassium dropped to 1%, cold and numb sensation, sweating, chest pressure, blood pressure was 223/105-110,Neck swelling, Throat swelling, Numb lips and disability. The patient's medical history, as provided by the reporter, included allergies to yellow 5 (tartrazine), shellfish, and bee stings. Concomitant product use was not provided by the reporter. On 19 Jan 2021 at 11:42 AM, approximately two minutes prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 19 Jan 2021, minutes after receiving the vaccine, the patient experienced a cold and numb sensation on the upper right part of her back. The sensation extended around her shoulder and into her clavicle region. Approximately 30 minutes after vaccination she started sweating and felt like she was going into anaphylactic shock, which she had experienced in the past. The patient felt like her throat was swelling and her neck started to visibly swell. One hour after vaccination, the patients lips went numb, the clavicular numbness continued, and she started to experience chest pressure. A paramedic then evaluated the patient, her blood pressure was 223/105-110 mmHg, she was placed in an ambulance, given diphenhydramine and solumedrol, then taken to the emergency room. At the emergency room, the patient received a chest x-ray, computed tomography scan, blood tests, and an electrocardiogram. Previously, the patient had a blood test which showed a potassium of 4.3 to 3.9 "or something." At the emergency room, her potassium had "dropped to 1%." The patient was administered potassium in the hospital and was held for observation until approximately 10:00 PM, then discharged. On 20 Jan 2021, the patient continued to experience chest tightness. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not provided. The outcome of the events anaphylactic shock, potassium dropped to 1%, cold and numb sensation, sweating,blood pressure was 223/105-110 ,Neck swelling, Throat swelling, Numb lips and disability was unknown. The event, chest pressure was considered not resolved.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 69-year-old, female patient with medical history of allergies to yellow 5 (tartrazine), shellfish, and bee stings, who experienced a serious, unexpected event of anaphylactic shock, sweating, hypoaesthesia, pharyngeal swelling, neck swelling, numb lips, chest discomfort, hypertension, hypokalemia and disability NOS. The event occurred the day the first dose of mRNA-1273 was administered. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

She denied any chest pain, shortness of breath, abdominal pain, headaches, fever at that time. Pt was left in room by herself for approximately 5 minutes and was found unresponsive. Code Blue was called. Pt was found in asystole. ACLS was initiated. Return of circulation occurred after 7 minutes of resuscitation. Pt is currently intubated and sedated.

69 2021-02-07 shortness of breath Brain aneurysm; Anaphylactic reaction; Collapsed; BP sky rocketed; Shortness of breath; A spontaneou... Read more
Close
Brain aneurysm; Anaphylactic reaction; Collapsed; BP sky rocketed; Shortness of breath; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 69-year-old female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 Vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced blood pressure skyrocketed, shortness of breath, loss of consciousness, massive anaphylactic reaction, and brain aneurysm. The patient's medical history, as provided by the reporter, included high blood pressure and arthritis. Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event, included an antihypertensive. On 04 Jan 2021, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. Twenty-two minutes later she had a massive anaphylactic reaction. She experienced shortness of breath, blood pressure skyrocketed, and loss of consciousness. She was taken to the emergency room. The patient had a brain aneurysm and never recovered. No treatment information was provided. The patient died on 04 Jan 2021. The cause of death was reported as brain aneurysm. Plans for an autopsy were not provided.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 69-year-old, female patient with a medical history of hypertension, who experienced fatal, serious, unexpected events of Anaphylactic reaction, hypertension, dyspnea, loss of consciousness and brain aneurysm. The events occurred 22 minutes after the first dose of mRNA-1273 was administered. No treatment information was provided. The patient never recovered and died. The cause of death was reported as brain aneurysm. Very limited information regarding this event has been provided at this time. Based on temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Additional information has been requested.; Reported Cause(s) of Death: Brain aneurysm

As of now, it appears to be completely resolved but I will not take the second dose for fear of a bad reaction.

Inflammatory markers for notable for CRP of 120, D-dimer 805, ferritin 276. She was treated with dexamethasone (and prophylactic ivermectin) and Lovenox 1 mg/kg twice daily. Remdesivir was deferred given the onset of symptoms > 5 days PTA. She had good response to treatment and over the next 3 days her oxygen was tapered off and she had very good symptomatic improvement. While she is unsure if it is a result of the vaccination, she reported to the pharmacy and asked us to report to the manufacturer.

69 2021-03-18 throat tightness Patient presented for second dose - reported feeling dizzy while in the observation area. Upon get... Read more
Close
Patient presented for second dose - reported feeling dizzy while in the observation area. Upon getting home she felt like her throat was closing and her chest was tight, heart pounding, cheeks were flushed and painful. These symptoms lasted 10 minutes. She applied cold compresses to her cheeks. After 10 minutes she began to feel better. She did not seek treatment or call her doctor.
69 2021-03-18 shortness of breath Unable to think; wobbly legs; Weak legs; Unable to eat; Dizzy; Shortness of breath/ Difficulty breat... Read more
Close
Unable to think; wobbly legs; Weak legs; Unable to eat; Dizzy; Shortness of breath/ Difficulty breathing; Fever of 101 degrees Fahrenheit; Chills; Nauseated; A spontaneous report was received from a Health Care Professional concerning 69 years old female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced Mental impairment, which is medically significant and experienced Dyspnoea, Chills, Pyrexia, Muscular weakness, Mobility decreased, Nausea, Dizziness, Feeding disorder and Product dose omission issue of routine medicines. The patient's medical history was provided as Covid-19 infection on OCT 2020 and current illness was provided as back problem and 11 mm gallstone. Historical medication was reported as REMDESIVIR for Covid-19 infection. Relevant concomitant medications were reported as Lisinopril-HCTZ daily, Mobic 15 mg daily, Tylenol 1000 mg as needed up to 3 times daily, Multivitamin, Vitamin C, Vitamin D, Vitamin B12, Calcium and Zinc. On 05 MAR 2021, prior to the onset of the event, the patient received their first dose of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot/batch: 024A21A) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 06 MAR 2021, the patient woke and felt like she was dying, described as having difficulty breathing and almost hyperventilating. She called her daughter-in-law who was a hospital nurse who advised her to breath slowly. The patient had shortness of breath, chills, and a temperature of 101 degrees Fahrenheit. Her legs were so weak that she had to use a walker to get from her bed to the couch, where she stayed until 2:30 am Sunday morning 7Mar2021. While she was on her couch she used a heating pad and was not able to sit up because she was nauseated and dizzy. She was unable to eat anything since Friday night until Sunday afternoon at 1:30 pm. She said she couldn't think on Saturday, and she missed her medicines until she was able to resume taking them Sunday evening 07 Mar 2021. The symptoms were not treated, except for use of the heating pad on Saturday. On 07-mar-2021, Sunday morning at 2:30 am her fever broke. The patient was not as nauseated and did not get dizzy, so she sat up. The patient legs were not as weak and were not wobbling, so she went back to her bed. She began feeling better by 6 or 7 pm on Sunday evening, with no fever, chills, and walking fine. On 08 Mar 2021 she feels fine, excepting she has still had some shortness of breath. The patient had status post Covid-19 infection since October 2020. The patient was hospitalized and received remdesivir therapy for Covid-19 infection prior to receiving the Moderna Covid-19 first dose. She also was already scheduled for two surgeries, one on her back and one for a 11 mm gallstone removal, prior to receiving this first vaccine dose. Her doctor told her she must have the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine prior to beingable to have her surgeries. She describes her symptoms as feeling like she had Covid-19 again. Laboratory details were not provided. Treatment information was provided as heating pad. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was unknown. On 07 MAR 2021, the outcome of the event's Mental impairment, Chills, Pyrexia, Muscular weakness, Mobility decreased, Nausea, Dizziness, feeding disorder and Product dose omission issue of routine medicine was considered as resolved. At the of this report, the outcome of the event's Dyspnoea was considered as not resolved.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information has been requested.

1st injection: 2/11/21 sore left arm for 24 hrs. 2nd injection: 3/11/21 7:30pm sore arm developed, became exhausted, slight headache & wheezing. 3/12/21 arm hurt, exhausted, headache, wheezing. In bed all day sleeping. 3/13/21 Walked 10,000 steps, tired, headache, wheezing during the day. 3/14/21 walked 10,000 steps. Feeling better. Then 5 pm began feeling achy, tired., bed 9pm. Awoke 10:30pm with nausea stomach pains. 12:30 am vomited. No more sleeping and increased wheezing. 3/15/21 no walk, exhausted and slept in bed all day. Upset stomach. 3/16/21 no walk. felt ok until 10:30am. Became exhausted, increased wheezing and upset stomach. 3/17/21 No walk. Felt slightly better, did nothing but sat in chair. Increased wheezing, started Albuterol inhaler, upset stomach, slight headache. 3/18/21 no walk. Felt terrible , in bed all day sleeping. Headache, wheezing, called doc to renew Albuterol inhaler. 3/19/21 Felt good but still wheezing. 3/20/21 Wheezing but feel pretty good, so far.

Close
Feeling of swelling in throat, and strange feeling in face, which happened at first vaccine. This was same reaction I received when starting allergy shots years ago (for grass, trees, etc. ) Reaction did not progress after the first vaccine, but persisted with headache for four hours. This time, while driving home, face felt like cement, throat felt full like I could barely swallow. Intensity subsided about 20 minutes later and I was able to drink, so I assumed it was okay. I had bad headache for 2 days. On day 2, noticed welts below and on sides of injection sights, which were painful to the touch. Today, they look like hives. I was not concerned about the headaches, but the strange feeling in my face and throat were concerning. I"ve never had painful hives after any vaccination.

69 2021-03-24 shortness of breath First vaccine on 1/16/2021, I experienced some numbing of my limbs (arms and legs). It was random an... Read more
Close
First vaccine on 1/16/2021, I experienced some numbing of my limbs (arms and legs). It was random and typically didn't last too long (except one time in my left arm that was quite dramatic and I took Bayer aspirin immediately) but was definitely not a normal experience in my body. After the second vaccine on 2/15/2021, the next day, I had the expected fever (100.1 to 100.9) throughout the next 2-days, along with no appetite, energy, or strength. I expected it to dissipate but by day 3 & 4, I felt even weaker and more exhausted. As the days turned into weeks (5+ weeks now), I've experienced severe exhaustion needing to sleep most days 9-13 hours, consistent numbness in my arms (con't next page) and some w/legs, blurry vision, and very unbalanced. I went from walking several miles a day to barely being able to walk a few blocks due to unbalance, weakness and being out of breath. This has gone on for over 5-weeks now. It feels like I am a long-hauler but without having had Covid. I've always been sensitive to drugs, expected to have a reaction, but never imagined something like this would go on for so long. During this period, I had two Covid tests on March 1 and March 10. Both were negative. The week of March 8, I came down with a good old fashioned cold. PCP asked for the second Covid test and chest x-ray (all clear) on March 10. PCP did lab work on March 5. Everything showed as "unremarkable".

69 2021-03-30 shortness of breath, blood clot in lung Patient began having symptoms 7 days after vaccination: chest pain, shortness of breath, feeling li... Read more
Close
Patient began having symptoms 7 days after vaccination: chest pain, shortness of breath, feeling like a lump in the throat. Over several days symptoms worsened, and included upper back pain and some pain in the upper left arm. Patient went to urgent care clinic on the morning of March 15, where staff decided to send patient by ambulance to the hospital. She was admitted to the hospital and diagnosed with having 5 blood clots in her lungs. She was discharged March 16 in the evening on Eliquis 5mg twice a day. She states the hospital did not know what caused the blood clots, and were aware she had been vaccinated recently. She has not had a doctor visit in years, but is now established with a primary care physician for follow-up care. The second Moderna dose was given today 3/31/21.
69 2021-04-05 fluid in lungs Pain in abd and side started on Saturday, patient reported to hospital on 4/6 found on CT scan to ha... Read more
Close
Pain in abd and side started on Saturday, patient reported to hospital on 4/6 found on CT scan to have: Multifocal patchy occlusive and nonocclusive PE involving the bilateral lower lobe and right upper lobe segmental and subsegmental pulmonary arteries. Suggestion of flattening of the interventricular septum raising the possibility of right heart strain. Peripheral airspace opacities in the bilateral lower lobes, left more than right, which could relate to a combination of evolving pulmonary infarcts and/or hypoventilatory changes. Small left pleural effusion.
69 2021-04-14 swelling in lungs, fluid in lungs 1. Bilateral acute pulmonary emboli noted. No evidence of right ventricular strain. 2. Prominence ... Read more
Close
1. Bilateral acute pulmonary emboli noted. No evidence of right ventricular strain. 2. Prominence of the pulmonary interstitium and ground-glass density throughout both lungs. This is suggestive of bilateral pulmonary edema. Bilateral pneumonia can give a similar appearance. 3. Small bilateral pleural effusions, right larger than left.

69 2021-04-20 lung pain, shortness of breath really really sick - with chemotherapy; blood pressure was slightly elevated; felt unusual; Temperat... Read more
Close
really really sick - with chemotherapy; blood pressure was slightly elevated; felt unusual; Temperature was 100.4F.; exhausted; pressure in the area of her cancer (left lung cancer)/felt was like somebody was squeezing her lungs/tightened up in the area of her cancer; painful in the area of her cancer; difficulty in breathing; lot of discomfort; Second dose administered on 38th day; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of RESPIRATORY TRACT IRRITATION (pressure in the area of her cancer (left lung cancer)/felt was like somebody was squeezing her lungs/tightened up in the area of her cancer), PULMONARY PAIN (painful in the area of her cancer) and DYSPNOEA (difficulty in breathing) in a 69-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 013M20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event (No recorded medical history). On 09-Feb-2021, the patient received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 19-Mar-2021, the patient experienced INAPPROPRIATE SCHEDULE OF PRODUCT ADMINISTRATION (Second dose administered on 38th day). On 23-Mar-2021, the patient experienced RESPIRATORY TRACT IRRITATION (pressure in the area of her cancer (left lung cancer)/felt was like somebody was squeezing her lungs/tightened up in the area of her cancer) (seriousness criterion intervention required), PULMONARY PAIN (painful in the area of her cancer) (seriousness criterion intervention required), DYSPNOEA (difficulty in breathing) (seriousness criterion intervention required) and DISCOMFORT (lot of discomfort). On 27-Mar-2021, the patient experienced ILLNESS (really really sick - with chemotherapy), HYPERTENSION (blood pressure was slightly elevated), MALAISE (felt unusual), PYREXIA (Temperature was 100.4F.) and FATIGUE (exhausted). On 19-Mar-2021, INAPPROPRIATE SCHEDULE OF PRODUCT ADMINISTRATION (Second dose administered on 38th day) had resolved. On 26-Mar-2021, RESPIRATORY TRACT IRRITATION (pressure in the area of her cancer (left lung cancer)/felt was like somebody was squeezing her lungs/tightened up in the area of her cancer), PULMONARY PAIN (painful in the area of her cancer), DYSPNOEA (difficulty in breathing) and DISCOMFORT (lot of discomfort) had resolved. On 31-Mar-2021, ILLNESS (really really sick - with chemotherapy), HYPERTENSION (blood pressure was slightly elevated), MALAISE (felt unusual), PYREXIA (Temperature was 100.4F.) and FATIGUE (exhausted) had resolved. Not Provided Concomitant product use was not provided by the reporter. Because of chemotherapy the patient rescheduled her second shot and so it was delayed. Four days after the second shot she got pressure in the area of her cancer (left lung cancer), it tightened up, she had difficulty in breathing, painful, lot of discomfort, it was like somebody was squeezing her lungs. Few days later (2-3 days) she got really really sick and felt very tired - she was under chemotherapy. This never happened before with the chemotherapy (she has been taking it from several years). Her blood pressure was slightly elevated. Temperature was 100.4F. She felt very unusual and exhausted. All this happened for about for about 4-5 days. Treatment for the event included acetylsalicylic acid. The patient received both scheduled doses of mRNA-1273 prior to the event; therefore, action taken with the drug in response to the event is not applicable. Company Comment - Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of these event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. However, noting the subject's currently chemotherapy may remain as confounder. This report refers to a case of (inappropriate schedule of product administration) for mRNA-1273, lot # 013M20A, with no associated AEs. Further information has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of these event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. However, noting the subject's currently chemotherapy may remain as confounder. This report refers to a case of (inappropriate schedule of product administration) for mRNA-1273, lot # 013M20A, with no associated AEs. Further information has been requested.

allergic reaction to the vaccine; Chills; Shortness of Breath; Light Headedness; Numbness of the cheek; Pressure on the chest; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of DYSPNOEA (Shortness of Breath) in a 69-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 046A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event (No medical reported history). On 26-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 26-Mar-2021, the patient experienced DYSPNOEA (Shortness of Breath) (seriousness criterion medically significant), DIZZINESS (Light Headedness), HYPOAESTHESIA (Numbness of the cheek) and CHEST DISCOMFORT (Pressure on the chest). On 04-Apr-2021, the patient experienced VACCINATION COMPLICATION (allergic reaction to the vaccine) and CHILLS (Chills). On 26-Mar-2021, DIZZINESS (Light Headedness) had resolved. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Event onset the same day as mRNA-1273. 70 2021-01-26 shortness of breath Intermittent paralyzed left side; Hives; itching; Redness; Shortness of breath; A spontaneous report... Read more
Close
Intermittent paralyzed left side; Hives; itching; Redness; Shortness of breath; A spontaneous report was received from a nurse who was also a 70-year-old, female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and developed left sided paralysis, shortness of breath, hives, itching, and redness. The patient's medical history included asthma. Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event, included albuterol sulfate, epinephrine and diphenhydramine. On 05 Jan 2021, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 075T202A) intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 05 Jan 2021, after receiving the vaccine the patient developed redness, itching and shortness of breath. On 06 Jan 2021, she developed hives and was paralyzed after sleeping. She experienced paralysis on the left side and her right side felt heavy. Treatment for the events included diphenhydramine, epinephrine, and albuterol. Action taken with the second dose of mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not provided. The events, paralysis on the left side and hives, was considered resolved on 07 Jan 2021. The events, redness, itching and shortness of breath, was considered resolved on 12 Jan 2021.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 70 year old, female patient, with a medical history of asthma, who experienced a serious unexpected event of hemiplegia, a non-serious unexpected event of dyspnoea, urticaria, pruritus and a non-serious expected event of erythema. The event of dyspnoea, pruritus, and erythema occurred 1 day after first dose mRNA-1273 (Lot# 075T202A) administration. The event of hemiplegia and urticaria occurred 3 days after first dose mRNA-1273 (Lot# 075T202A) administration. Both concomitant and treatment medications included Benadryl, Primatene mist and albuterol. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

70 2021-02-01 shortness of breath After receiving the injection, I was directed by an RN to sit in a chair for 15min in the same room.... Read more
Close
After receiving the injection, I was directed by an RN to sit in a chair for 15min in the same room. Five minutes after the injection I felt my upper back muscles, ribcage area, contract. The contraction continued around to the front of my chest with next 3 minutes. I felt tightness with each breath. The RN who gave me the injection came to see if I felt alright. She informed the charge nurse that my chest felt tight and the charge nurse came to ask me questions. The charge nurse called the hospital pharmacist to come to see me. The pharmacist arrived with various medications and talked to me. He instructed me to do breathing exercises and meditate. I told him that I was familiar with these techniques and using them. I also informed the pharmacist that I had a heart attack in 2018 and had atrial tachycardia but I wasn't feeling any problems with my heart, that it was beating normally. I also informed the pharmacist of my severe allergies to certain items but I wasn't experiencing any anaphylaxis that I've experienced in past allergic episodes. The pharmacist left and told the charge nurse to keep me a half hour longer under observation and to call him if I felt worse. During that half hour, the muscle contractions stopped and I was able to breathe normally. The charge nurse asked me if I was ready to leave after the half hour was up, I told her I was feeling odd so she said to stay another 20min. I began to experience intestinal cramping and asked to leave to go to the bathroom. In the bathroom I had a bout of diarreah that lasted 10minutes. After that I drove home but was experiencing a headache that started. The headache lasted for 20hrs. It felt like I was wearing tight hat, squeezing. Iv'e not had that type of headache before. My right arm site of injection feels a little warm and is pink but isn't painful.
70 2021-02-03 shortness of breath Profuse sweating, feeling faint, and a little trouble breathing.

Throat swelling stopped and gradually returned to normal by about 10:45 am. Headache continued through next day.

30 minutes after injection, throat felt scratchy. 45 minutes after injection, roof of mouth felt swollen. Then lips were numb. Felt it was allergic reaction and took Claritin which helped a bit. Then took Benedryl 25 mg. which seems to help further. Took at 5PM and 9PM. Saw the doctor the next morning (2/5) and he prescribed methylPrednisolone to take PRN. That evening, throat and roof of mouth felt a bit swollen so I took both Benedryl and prednisone. 2/6 Felt fine all day until about 9:30pm, felt hot and a bit of nausea. Again took Benedryl and prednisone. 2/7, this morning, feeling very tired but no allergy symptoms. All vitals were normal this whole time.

Close
Woke up because of itching in groin area, stomach. Took 1 Benadryl and was able to go back to sleep. On getting up at 6am, wrists were itching as well, bumps under my watch which I removed. Took 1 Benadryl. Red blotches developed under my arms, across my belly and around my sides, into the crease of my thighs and on my thighs, with small bumps. Throat was tight. Fingers visibly swelling. Video call with Dr. resulted in Rx 40 MG Prednisone 1/day for 4 days. Increased Symbicort to 2 puffs/2x day, and told to swallow air. Zyrtec 2x day. Benadryl 1-2 every 4 hours. Took 1 20mg Prednisone at 5p in hopes of sleeping, rest as prescribed. Saturday took all meds at 6am. Had blotches, itching, but reduced within 2 hours. Took 1 Benadryl only, but increased to 2 T 1p because blotches and rash on belly were returning. Took evening meds at 6 p, and, 1 Prednisone 20mg at 11 because again blotching and rash including near knees. Sunday was up at 3a because of Prednisone, no itching. Took meds at 7a, new bumps and blotching on wrists. Taking Benadryl 2 tabs every 4 hours.

70 2021-02-21 painful respiration Approximately 14 hours after receiving the vaccine, I woke up at 2:15 a.m. feeling pains in my chest... Read more
Close
Approximately 14 hours after receiving the vaccine, I woke up at 2:15 a.m. feeling pains in my chest middle and extending through to my upper back. The pain encompassed the span of my upper chest and back from one arm to the other. I experienced very rapid heartbeats that I could feel throbbing from my head to my chest. I was hesitant to move or rise from my bed because of the pain. At 3:40 I called 911. They did an EKG and I was told that my heart was fine. My blood pressure was 180/90. I chose not to go to the hospital but to call my doctor when his office opened up at 9:00 a.m. in approximately 5 hours. My doctor had me come into his office. I had another EKG which was fine and he sent me to have a Cat Scan. the same day which was also fine. My doctor spoke to me and said that he felt that this was due to side effects of the vaccine. I doubled up on my Acid Reflux medicine, taking 80 mg daily for four days through Monday 2/22/2021. I could not sleep well for three days after the vaccine experiencing pain in my chest and could not breathe deeply without feeling it. Then I steadily improved and today I can take deep breaths with little pain. I also experienced muscle pain in my left shoulder and neck but used Mineral Ice on my neck and was relieved in one day.

My left upper quadrant is sore from the Moderna vaccine. It appears to be spreading circular to the size of a quarter to about the size of a fifty-cent piece. I had gone to sleep. I contacted the veteran 24 hour nurse, my best friend, and my brother to tell them my health status. I had eaten dinner, taken a Tylenol, and went back to sleep before brushing my teeth.

After the first vaccine, patient stated she had chest and throat tightness for 7 days. After the second vaccine, 5 minutes later, patient stated she had severe dizziness, shortness of breath, fainted, shaking, elevated blood pressure to 161/70, passed out. A facility called 911 for the patient. Patient was taken to the emergency room and treated with Ativan and meclizine. 2 EKGs and CXR in ER were normal. Patient spend 1 night in the hospital. The next day, all symptoms returned. Patient was treated with benadryl, zofran, and meclizine. Patient is still taking meclizine for dizziness. 70 2021-03-07 wheezing, shortness of breath, throat tightness Choked with food; Started wheezing trying to expel the food; felt like her throat closed when chokin... Read more
Close
Choked with food; Started wheezing trying to expel the food; felt like her throat closed when choking with the food; Hard to breathe when choking with the food; Difficulty lifting her left arm; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 70 years-old, female patient who received Modern's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced choking with food/ choked on food, Started wheezing trying to expel the food/ wheezing, felt like her throat closed when choking with the food/ throat tightness, hard to breathe when choking with the food/ breathing difficulty, difficulty lifting her left arm/ Arm discomfort. The patient's medical history was not reported. Concomitant product use included blood pressure medication. On 02 Feb 2021, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received the first dose of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot/batch: unknown) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 02 Feb 2021, approximately 3 hours after getting the vaccine, she started eating and choked with the food, and when trying to expel it, she started wheezing, felt like her throat closed and was hard to breath more than usual for this kind of situations. She also has difficulty lifting her left arm. The seriousness criteria were considered as medically significant for the event choked on food. Treatment information was not reported Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events is not reported. The events choking with food/ choked on food, Started wheezing trying to expel the food/ wheezing, felt like her throat closed when choking with the food/ throat tightness, hard to breathe when choking with the food/ breathing difficulty, difficulty lifting her left arm/ Arm discomfort were considered resolved.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 70-year-old female who experienced a serious unexpected event of choking along with NS unexpected events of throat tightness, wheezing, dyspnea, and arm discomfort. The events occurred 3 hours after the first dose of mRNA-1273. Treatment not reported. Event outcomes resolved. Based on current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded

Within a minute or two of getting the vaccine my throat felt like it started to close up. It has felt like that since the vaccination and has not let up. The nurse who administered the dose notified someone within the pharmacy. They had me wait an additional 15 minutes and checked on me. No change. I was told to go to hospital if the symptom got worse.

Two week after receiving the Moderna vaccine, patient started to have a high fever, body aches all over, coughing, congestion, and oxygen levels would not remain stable. On 3/15 she was admitted the hospital. She is still currently in the hospital and her blood oxygen levels remain around 80. She has fluid in her lungs and around her heart. Her liver enzymes remain highly elevated.

Close
At 1:53 pm the patient received her COVID vaccine in her left deltoid and was told to wait in the parking lot for 30 minutes. At 1:58 pm the patient reported to the NG medic her throat felt tight and was swelling. EPI auto injector was administered at 1:58 pm by NG medic in her right thigh. Sat 97% and HR 96. At 2:00 patient reported she was feeling better. O2 sats 98% and HR 95. Notified EMS and they arrived at 2:05. Patients BP 160/82, O2 sats 99% and HR 84. Pt refused transport to the ER and left at 2:20pm with a friend who had drove her.

Patient reported she had a few symptoms from previous vaccine (Tdap and flu) where her arm got numb 4 hours later. Vaccine administered at 3:11p.,m.. Patient reported feeling short of breath nurse was called out to car. patient alert and oriented X4, skin pink w/d, at this time started complaining of not being able to swallow and holding her throat area. Oral Benadryl 5omg administered where patient continued to complain of difficulty of swallowing and visibly looked like she was having trouble. 4:01 p.m. Epi-pen administered and 911 called. 70 2021-03-18 throat swelling About 5 minutes after receiving 2nd dose of Moderna vaccine client began complaining of chest pain, ... Read more
Close
About 5 minutes after receiving 2nd dose of Moderna vaccine client began complaining of chest pain, and feeling of throat closing. RN and EMT present at client's side. Noted that lungs had crackles. EMT gave a total of 324 mg of Baby Aspirin at 1630 (Four 81mg tablets). At this time client's BP was 197/98. At 1633 EMT gave one 0.4mg dose of Nitro sublingual. Client's BP at this time was 176/87. Ambulance arrived and took client to hospital.

felt like choking; coughing every day; Runny Nose; felt like wheezing; cold chills; A spontaneous report was received from a 70-year-old female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced felt like choking, coughing every day, runny nose, cold chills and felt like wheezing. The patient's medical history included blood pressure abnormal and thyroid disorder nos. Concomitant medications included thyroid medication, blood pressure medication, fish oil, levocetirizine dihydrochloride and vitamin d. On 18-FEB-2021, the patient received their one of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 013M20A) intramuscularly on left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On the same day, patient experienced coughing and she felt sick. The patient had runny nose, cold chills and felt like she was wheezing and chocking from unspecified date in FEB-2021. The patient started using an inhaler which she got from her daughter. The doctor gave her prescription for cough medication. The patient's daughter gave her Tessalon (benzonatate) 200mg. Physician was aware of patient's symptoms. The patient was scheduled for second dose on 18-MAR-2021. Action taken with mRNA-1273 was unknown. The outcome of the events, felt like choking, coughing every day, runny nose, cold chills and felt like wheezing was unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information has been requested.

70 2021-03-22 shortness of breath Headache, body ache, dyspnea, cough, chills, diarrhea, abdominal pain X 8 days No treatment
70 2021-03-22 shortness of breath not quite 2 days later, i started having trouble breathing, and i had not had any symptoms of the as... Read more
Close
not quite 2 days later, i started having trouble breathing, and i had not had any symptoms of the asthma or the COPD because i only experience trouble breathing after a case of the flu or a severe cold, which always leads to congestion, and often pneumonia. There was constant coughing and gasping for air, a tightness in my chest. I went online to see if there were any other people who had experienced this, and the literature was saying the problems with breathing usually start within a few hours, but mine took longer and I know it was related to the vaccine. I was given an ADVAIR inhaler which did nothing to alleviate the symptoms, so then had 3 weeks of prednisone, to the point i did not want to go for the second dose, but my doctor talked me into it as I have so many pre-existing conditions. I had no problem at all with the second dose and am now off the prednisone and the advair

My heart was racing ( I did not take pulse) for approximately 30 minutes (only a guess - seemed like an hour) My heartbeat was also irregular - skipping a beat every 5 to 15 beats for about an hour. For the next 48 hrs, I had severe headache, extreme fatigue, nauseousness, appetite loss, and some lung and nasal congestion. I slept most of the time

70 2021-03-24 shortness of breath MODERNA COVID-19 VACCINE EUA 1:45 while playing 9 holes of golf, experienced lightheadedness, dizzin... Read more
Close
MODERNA COVID-19 VACCINE EUA 1:45 while playing 9 holes of golf, experienced lightheadedness, dizziness, headache and vision blacked out momentarily. Heart racing tremendously; experienced left arm tingling pain, tightness in chest and then severe jaw pain. Golf partner called EMS, took one tab of Nitroglycerine and 4 81mg of of Aspirins. EMS arrived at golf course, heart rate remained high; between 190 to 204. Got me inside of ambulance and issues a heart stopping drug to reset the heart. Admitted to Medical Center within the next 2 hours. Several EKGs, blood work, etc., showing some heart damage. Sent home on 3/5/2021 with diagnosis of SVT (supraventricular tachycardia); monitoring accordingly now. Wore heart monitor for 15 days. Still SOB (short of breath); upper back pains, sharp shooting pains in left upper part of back radiating into the heart area, and other issues; dizziness and malaise (very tired). Before shot was working out, walking, playing golf, dancing. Performing many duties of household experiences with never any issues.

70 2021-03-26 throat tightness First symptom was tightening of throat on 2/18/2021 not closing nor sore just tightening. That las... Read more
Close
First symptom was tightening of throat on 2/18/2021 not closing nor sore just tightening. That lasted 48 hours. Joint pain started after throat dissipated on Friday 2/19/21. Joint pain was progressive from shoulders for several days, then knees for a day, then tops of one foot for one night, then it moved to my hands. I had swelling where I could not close my hands. I had severe and exstremely painful joint pain in both hands that kept me up at night and unable to pick up things or close my hands. I used ice packs for some relief. It would sometimes calm down somewhat for hours and I would think it was over and then it would come back . The hand symptoms lasted from 2/23/21 through 3/5/21 when pain began to slowly calm down. I had one hand that would not close into a fist for one day 3/6/21 when pain was much less. By Sunday 3/7/21 most symtoms were much less with symptoms dissipating all together. I have had no recurrence since the weekend of 3/6/21 of any symptoms.

sweating; Pain in arm; Fever; Chest pain (left side); No bowel movement-watery; Labored breathing; Over sleeping; Passed out; Chills; Dizziness; Headache; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 70-years-old female patient who received Moderna COVID 19 vaccine and experienced pain in arm, dizziness, major chest pain (left side), pain in shoulder, neck, headache, no bowel movement-watery, chills, labored breathing, passed out, over sleeping, no urine, sweating, fever and sore throat. The patient's medical history included congestive heart failure, high blood pressure and gout and had 3 heart attacks in lifetime. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. On 12 Mar 2021, prior to the onset of the event, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot/batch number: 031A21A) intramuscularly for COVID-19 prophylaxis. On 12 Mar 2021, the patient experienced headache and dizziness. On 13 Mar 2021, the patient experienced pain in arm, major chest pain (left side), pain in shoulder, neck, no bowel movement-watery, chills, labored breathing, passed out, over sleeping, no urine, sweating, fever and sore throat. Treatment for the event included nitroglycerin and paracetamol. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. The outcome of the event dizziness was resolved on 12 Mar 2021. The outcome of the events chills, fever and headache was resolved on 14 Mar 2021. The outcome of the events pain in arm, major chest pain (left side), pain in shoulder, neck, no bowel movement-watery, labored breathing, passed out, over sleeping, no urine, sweating and sore throat was resolved on 15 Mar 2021.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 70 Y/O F with a serious unexpected loss of consciousness and NS unexpected dizziness, chest pain, dyspnea, gastrointestinal motility disorder, hypersomnia, hyperhidrosis, and expected pain in extremity, pyrexia, chills, headache. Event onset Day 1 after first dose mRNA-1273. Events resolved. Based on current available information and temporal association between use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Bronchial tubes began to close up; Low oxygen levels to 83%; Swelling of face; hard time catching breath; terrible body ache; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of BRONCHOSPASM (Bronchial tubes began to close up) in a 70-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 040A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concurrent medical conditions included Pulmonary disorder (Reported consulting pulmonologist ). Concomitant products included METOPROLOL, OXYCODONE and Nebulizer for an unknown indication. On 09-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 10-Mar-2021, the patient experienced BRONCHOSPASM (Bronchial tubes began to close up) (seriousness criterion medically significant), OXYGEN SATURATION DECREASED (Low oxygen levels to 83%), SWELLING FACE (Swelling of face), DYSPNOEA (hard time catching breath) and PAIN (terrible body ache). At the time of the report, BRONCHOSPASM (Bronchial tubes began to close up), OXYGEN SATURATION DECREASED (Low oxygen levels to 83%), SWELLING FACE (Swelling of face), DYSPNOEA (hard time catching breath) and PAIN (terrible body ache) was resolving. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 10-Mar-2021, Oxygen saturation: 83 % (Low) Low. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Treatment medications included prednisone and other medications. Very limited information regarding this event has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Very limited information regarding this event has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.

70 2021-04-14 acute respiratory failure Patient suffered cardiac arrest two days (on 3/5) following first dose Moderna Vaccine at Rite Aid ... Read more
Close
Patient suffered cardiac arrest two days (on 3/5) following first dose Moderna Vaccine at Rite Aid Pharmacy (3/3). The following is the Discharge Summary From 3/26. Resident Attestation: I personally saw and examined the patient on rounds with my cariology resident team on the day of the resident's note. Management was discussed with the cardiology resident and I supervised the plan of care. I have reviewed and agree with the key parts of the resident evaluation including: Subjective information Objective findings on physical exam Impression and plan Gen: appears comfortable, sitting in bed Resp: clear. no wheezes, rhonchi, rales CV: normal rate, regular, no m/r/g Abd: soft, nt/nd Ext: warm, no edema. Pressure ulcer boots on. Pleasant 70-year-old woman who had a history of PVCs, left bundle branch block, and a mild nonischemic cardiomyopathy, came into the hospital following a VT/VF cardiac arrest. Her echocardiogram done while in the hospital showed a preserved ejection fraction. Her cardiac catheterization showed normal coronary arteries. She had implantation of an ICD. Hospital course has been complicated by watershed cerebral infarcts. In addition, she had an episode of C. difficile colitis. She has gradually improved over the course of the past 3 weeks. From a cardiovascular perspective, she is being discharged on carvedilol 25 mg twice a day, lisinopril 10 mg daily, and her home atorvastatin. With regards to her etiology of cardiac arrest, I would be suspicious about the possibility of sarcoidosis. However, we were not able to get a cardiac MR while she was inpatient due to her strokes and inability to consistently follow commands and hold her breath. Would recommend consideration of an outpatient PET. She is ready to discharge to subacute rehab today. I have spent greater than 30 minutes in discharge planning. Primary Discharge Diagnosis VT/VF cardiac arrest, s/p therapeutic hypothermia S/p AICD placement 3/16/2021 Secondary Discharge Diagnoses Anoxic brain injury, recovering, with persistent aphasia and dysphagia C. difficile colitis Nonsustained ventricular tachycardia, resolved DETAILS OF HOSPITAL STAY Presenting Problem/History of Present Illness 70 y.o. female, with history of nonischemic cardiomyopathy, admitted on 3/5/2021 after out of hospital VT/VF cardiac arrest. She completed therapeutic hypothermia protocol. Cardiac catheterization did not show any significant obstructive coronary disease. TTE showed LVEF 55%. Patient underwent AICD placement on 3/16/2021. Had some recurrent nonsustained ventricular tachycardia afterward, which resolved after increasing her carvedilol doses. Her course was complicated by a C. difficile infection, treated with PO Vancomycin, with significant improvement in diarrhea. She has had gradual neurologic recovery. Neurology felt she had had several watershed infarcts, but felt that she would continue to have a prolonged recovery over the next few months. Had some recovery of language/cognition prior to discharge. Due to her waxing/waning encephalopathy, she did not qualify for inpatient rehab, but will be discharged to subacute rehab. Discharged with tube feeding continued, though she can begin sips with speech therapy supervision. Patient seen and examined at bedside on the day of discharge. She stated that she had no pain, though HPI/ROS still limited due to aphasia. Discussed above information with patient's husband, who understood and was in agreement with the plan. Problem-Based Hospital Course NEURO Acute metabolic encephalopathy, with gradual recovery -Due to neurologic injury from cardiac arrest. -Neurology consult: concern for anoxic brain injury with watershed infarcts, anticipate very gradual recovery over the coming months. No acute process on imaging. -Patient extubated on 3/11, following some commands. Continuing to regain conversational ability and motor function gradually each day. Has some waxing and waning of mental status, but overall her encephalopathy continues to improve. -Limit centrally acting/sedating medications -Speech following for language/cognition as well as dysphagia requiring tube feeding. Can begin some sips in addition to tube feeds. -Continue tube feeds via Dobbhoff tube per instructions provided on after visit summary INFECTIOUS DISEASE C. Difficile Colitis: -C.Diff Positive 3/18. Continue 125 mg PO Vancomycin Q6H for 10 days (3/18 - 3/27), confirmed with infectious disease -Frequency of diarrhea has decreased significantly, was stable after rectal tube removed 2-3 days prior to discharge Pneumonia, likely due to aspiration, resolved -s/p 5 day course ceftriaxone (3/5 - 3/9 ) -CTA on admission showed significant RUL and RLL consolidation with air bronchograms, as well as some patchy airspace disease in LUL -Had copious tan sputum on suctioning 3/7 - respiratory culture negative CARDIOLOGY Out of hospital cardiac arrest, likely VT/VF -Pt's husband initiated chest compressions x 10 minutes, until police/fire dept arrival, when AED showed a shockable rhythm. Likely VT/VF arrest. -S/p therapeutic hypothermia protocol. -Troponin peaked at 1.09 -3/16 Successful single chamber ICD implantation Nonsustained ventricular tachycardia (NSVT), resolved Chronic left bundle branch block -Has had multiple episodes of NSVT noted on telemetry 3/19 - 3/20 -s/p ICD as above -Increased dose of Carvedilol to 25 mg BID with resolution of NSVT History of nonischemic cardiomyopathy, LVEF 55% -Echo in 11/2019 demonstrated EF 42% (nadir). -TTE on admission showed recovered EF to 55%, mild concentric LVH, normal RV systolic function, no valvular abnormalities -Was initially started on aspirin/statin due to high suspicion for CAD, but as cardiac cath 3/15 was unremarkable, these medications were discontinued. -3/16 Successful single chamber ICD implantation Hypertension -Blood pressure now improved after restarting home lisinopril and initiating carvedilol -HCTZ discontinued as BP now well controlled on above regimen RENAL Oliguria, resolved -Pt initially had low urine output since admission, improved to 0.5 cc/kg/hr on 3/9. Continue fluids with free water flushes through tube feeds -Has had normal electrolytes, renal function, and urine output since initial renal recovery. RESPIRATORY Acute hypoxic respiratory failure secondary to cardiac arrest, s/p mechanical ventilation, extubated 3/11 -Patient successfully extubated 3/11, stable respiratory status. Protecting airway well. -Encourage incentive spirometry HEMATOLOGY Acute normocytic anemia, improving -Pt had Hgb drop from baseline around 13-14 at admission to 10.9, now around 10-11. -Has iron saturation of 11%. Close
Two days following first dose Moderna Vaccine at Pharmacy, she suffered a cardiac arrest. Below Discharge Summary From 3/26 hospital. Patient PCP Information Provider PCP Type DO General Discharge Summary by DO at 3/26/2021 12:42 PM Author: DO Service: Cardiology Author Type: Resident Filed: 3/26/2021 12:57 PM Date of Service: 3/26/2021 12:42 PM Status: Attested Editor: DO (Resident) Cosigner: MD at 3/26/2021 1:17 PM Resident Attestation: I personally saw and examined the patient on rounds with my cariology resident team on the day of the resident's note. Management was discussed with the cardiology resident and I supervised the plan of care. I have reviewed and agree with the key parts of the resident evaluation including: Subjective information Objective findings on physical exam Impression and plan Gen: appears comfortable, sitting in bed Resp: clear. no wheezes, rhonchi, rales CV: normal rate, regular, no m/r/g Abd: soft, nt/nd Ext: warm, no edema. Pressure ulcer boots on. Pleasant 70-year-old woman who had a history of PVCs, left bundle branch block, and a mild nonischemic cardiomyopathy, came into the hospital following a VT/VF cardiac arrest. Her echocardiogram done while in the hospital showed a preserved ejection fraction. Her cardiac catheterization showed normal coronary arteries. She had implantation of an ICD. Hospital course has been complicated by watershed cerebral infarcts. In addition, she had an episode of C. difficile colitis. She has gradually improved over the course of the past 3 weeks. From a cardiovascular perspective, she is being discharged on carvedilol 25 mg twice a day, lisinopril 10 mg daily, and her home atorvastatin. With regards to her etiology of cardiac arrest, I would be suspicious about the possibility of sarcoidosis. However, we were not able to get a cardiac MR while she was inpatient due to her strokes and inability to consistently follow commands and hold her breath. Would recommend consideration of an outpatient. She is ready to discharge to subacute rehab today. I have spent greater than 30 minutes in discharge planning. Preferred Name: PATIENT PCP: DO Primary Cardiologist: MD Discharging Cardiologist: MD Admission Date: 3/5/2021 Admission Diagnosis: Cardiac arrest Discharge Date: 03/26/21 Discharge Summary Author: DO Primary Discharge Diagnosis VT/VF cardiac arrest, s/p therapeutic hypothermia S/p AICD placement 3/16/2021 Secondary Discharge Diagnoses Anoxic brain injury, recovering, with persistent aphasia and dysphagia C. difficile colitis Non-sustained ventricular tachycardia, resolved DETAILS OF HOSPITAL STAY Presenting Problem/History of Present Illness Patient is a 70 y.o. female, with history of nonischemic cardiomyopathy, admitted on 3/5/2021 after out of hospital VT/VF cardiac arrest. She completed therapeutic hypothermia protocol. Cardiac catheterization did not show any significant obstructive coronary disease. TTE showed LVEF 55%. Patient underwent AICD placement on 3/16/2021. Had some recurrent nonsustained ventricular tachycardia afterward, which resolved after increasing her carvedilol doses. Her course was complicated by a C. difficile infection, treated with PO Vancomycin, with significant improvement in diarrhea. She has had gradual neurologic recovery. Neurology felt she had had several watershed infarcts, but felt that she would continue to have a prolonged recovery over the next few months. Had some recovery of language/cognition prior to discharge. Due to her waxing/waning encephalopathy, she did not qualify for inpatient rehab, but will be discharged to subacute rehab. Discharged with tube feeding continued, though she can begin sips with speech therapy supervision. Patient seen and examined at bedside on the day of discharge. She stated that she had no pain, though HPI/ROS still limited due to aphasia. Discussed above information with patient's husband, who understood and was in agreement with the plan. Problem-Based Hospital Course NEURO Acute metabolic encephalopathy, with gradual recovery -Due to neurologic injury from cardiac arrest. -Neurology consult: concern for anoxic brain injury with watershed infarcts, anticipate very gradual recovery over the coming months. No acute process on imaging. -Patient extubated on 3/11, following some commands. Continuing to regain conversational ability and motor function gradually each day. Has some waxing and waning of mental status, but overall her encephalopathy continues to improve. -Limit centrally acting/sedating medications -Speech following for language/cognition as well as dysphagia requiring tube feeding. Can begin some sips in addition to tube feeds. -Continue tube feeds via tube per instructions provided on after visit summary INFECTIOUS DISEASE C. Difficile Colitis: -C.Diff Positive 3/18. whole shoulder is one big giant mess and feels tingling; whole shoulder is one big giant mess and feels burning; arm is kind of lumpy and itching and burning; arm is kind of lumpy and itching and burning; arm is kind of lumpy and itching and burning; face covered with giant hives, urticaria; her face was itching and she felt something funny; short of breath; Her lips were swollen and it was very itchy all around lips; Her lips were swollen and it was very itchy all around lips; arm was unmoveable; felt very sick and had a fever of 101.2; big red swollen area; This spontaneous case was reported by a non-health professional and describes the occurrence of ANGIOEDEMA (face covered with giant hives, urticaria) in a 70-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. UNK) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concurrent medical conditions included COPD. Concomitant products included HYDROCHLOROTHIAZIDE for Product used for unknown indication, SALBUTAMOL (ALBUTEROL) and BUDESONIDE, FORMOTEROL FUMARATE (SYMBICORT) for an unknown indication. On 02-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 02-Apr-2021, the patient experienced PYREXIA (felt very sick and had a fever of 101.2 ) and VACCINATION SITE SWELLING (big red swollen area). On 03-Apr-2021, the patient experienced ANGIOEDEMA (face covered with giant hives, urticaria) (seriousness criterion medically significant), PRURITUS (her face was itching and she felt something funny), DYSPNOEA (short of breath), LIP SWELLING (Her lips were swollen and it was very itchy all around lips), LIP PRURITUS (Her lips were swollen and it was very itchy all around lips) and LIMB DISCOMFORT (arm was unmoveable). On an unknown date, the patient experienced PARAESTHESIA (whole shoulder is one big giant mess and feels tingling), BURNING SENSATION (whole shoulder is one big giant mess and feels burning), VACCINATION SITE PRURITUS (arm is kind of lumpy and itching and burning), VACCINATION SITE INDURATION (arm is kind of lumpy and itching and burning) and VACCINATION SITE PAIN (arm is kind of lumpy and itching and burning). On 03-Apr-2021, ANGIOEDEMA (face covered with giant hives, urticaria) had resolved. At the time of the report, PRURITUS (her face was itching and she felt something funny), DYSPNOEA (short of breath), PARAESTHESIA (whole shoulder is one big giant mess and feels tingling), BURNING SENSATION (whole shoulder is one big giant mess and feels burning), LIP PRURITUS (Her lips were swollen and it was very itchy all around lips), VACCINATION SITE PRURITUS (arm is kind of lumpy and itching and burning), VACCINATION SITE INDURATION (arm is kind of lumpy and itching and burning), PYREXIA (felt very sick and had a fever of 101.2 ) and VACCINATION SITE PAIN (arm is kind of lumpy and itching and burning) outcome was unknown, LIP SWELLING (Her lips were swollen and it was very itchy all around lips) had resolved and LIMB DISCOMFORT (arm was unmoveable) and VACCINATION SITE SWELLING (big red swollen area) had not resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On an unknown date, Body temperature: 101.2 (High) fever. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. She was also taking an unspecified pain medicine. Patient was very scared at the time and did not know if she should go to the hospital or not. She took hydroxyzine, which she said did not work. The next day her arm was unmoveable, and her lips stayed swollen for three days. The hives went away at the end of the following day by 7 o'clock. Patient also felt very sick and had a fever of 101.2 the first night. Patient also reports not developing anything on her arm until a week later. Now has a big red swollen area, kind of lumpy and itching and burning. Pain has come back and gotten worse on arm, starting Monday. Her whole shoulder is one big giant mess. She feels tingling and burning. Patient still wondering what she should do. 71 2021-01-30 throat swelling I had an adverse reaction approximately 35 minutes after my injection when I was driving home. I ha... Read more
Close
I had an adverse reaction approximately 35 minutes after my injection when I was driving home. I had numbness on the left side of my mouth and lips which came on very quickly. This numbness was identical to the feeling of Novocain injected for dental work, except it came on much faster. My cheek and left side of the throat were swollen. I was also chilled. The intense numbness lasted about 20 minutes. The swelling did not worsen. 12 hours later I had some numbness and swelling in the bottom left lip. The cheek and throat swelling were gone. 24 hours following the injection I had swelling in the left side of the bottom lip and numbness in the corner of the left lip only. 36 hours later all symptoms were gone.

Patient had mild associated shortness of breath and chest pressure with onset of rash. Mild shortness of breath and chest pressure completely resolved within 1 hour.

71 2021-02-28 throat swelling Anaphylactic reaction; swollen throat; eyes itching; eyes swollen; swollen lips; She had hives all a... Read more
Close
Anaphylactic reaction; swollen throat; eyes itching; eyes swollen; swollen lips; She had hives all around her waistband, back, arms, chest, and her hair; Palms were red; palms were very itchy; her arm was tender; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 71-Year-Old female patient, who was administered Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine second dose and her arm was tender, palms were itchy, palms were very red, hives all around waistband, back, arms, chest and hair, swollen throat, swollen lips, eyes swollen and eyes itching and anaphylactic reaction. The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. On 13-Jan-2021 the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot Number:012L20A) Intramuscularly in the left arm. On 11-Feb-2021 prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their second of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 039K20A) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 11-Feb-2021, patient stated her arm was tender, but she was able to sleep on her side. On 12-Feb-2021 night, her palms were very itchy. On 13-Feb-2021, approximately at 04:30 am patient stated it was like someone had a blowtorched on her palms. Her palms were very red, "as red can be" and itching tremendously. When she used the bathroom, she had hives all around her waistband, back, arms, chest and her hair. Patient went to ER. Since her ER visit, patient stated some of her spots on her chest lighten up and her hands were not as bad. Patient denies ever having trouble of difficulty breathing. Patient called again and reported new adverse events from previous one. Patient went to ER for second time on 13 Feb 2021 night and experienced unbearable itching and burning. Patient felt okay until 15-Feb-2021 and went bed and woke up 1:30 am in the morning with swollen throat and lips and she thought she was experiencing anaphylactic reaction. Her eyes were swollen, itchy and needed help. Treatment for the event included patient put an ice pack between her hands for an hour on 13-Feb-2021. The ER gave her diphenhydramine and famotidine and patient was sent home with same medications. Patient also used arnicare gel for her whole waistband, which she stated was very cooling and helped with the burning and itching. Patient received 5 doses of steroids, diphenhydramine and famotidine after second ER visit. The patient received both scheduled dose of mRNA-1273; therefore, action taken with the drug in response to the event is not applicable. The events, arm was tender, palms were itchy, palms were very red, hives all around waistband, back, arms, chest and hair, swollen throat, swollen lips, eyes swollen and eyes itching and anaphylactic reaction, were considered unknow.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information has been requested.

Close
Got the vaccine and experienced slight shortness of breath, and then started developing a bronchitis-type cough that was very severe, very persistent and could not speak due to the bronchial cough. Her arm was not sore, no other symptoms other than the cough. She took Nyquil that night to go to bed, and then in the morning she went to the UC on 3/2/21, and she was prescribed and prescribed a rescue inhaler Albuterol sulfate, which has helped her. She does have an APT with her PCP tomorrow. At the 24 hour mark from the vaccine is when she noticed improvement and had had 2 doses of the inhaler. Did have a reaction to the flu vaccine in the past, and discussed this vaccine with the doctor who prescribed an Epi-Pen and told her to take Benadryl before the vaccine.

71 2021-03-15 shortness of breath HOSPITALIST HISTORY AND PHYSICAL DATE OF ADMISSION: 3/15/2021 DATE OF H&P: 3/16/2021 PATIENT D... Read more
Close
HOSPITALIST HISTORY AND PHYSICAL DATE OF ADMISSION: 3/15/2021 DATE OF H&P: 3/16/2021 PATIENT DEMOGRAPHIC: 71 year-old female MODE OF ARRIVAL: EMS. _____________________________________________________________ CHIEF COMPLAINT: Dyspnea and mild cough. HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: 71 year-old T2 diabetic female who presented to the ED late yesterday for evaluation of increasing shortness of breath. Also, reports she's had a nonproductive cough for several days. Yesterday, her breathing just sufficiently severe that she could not walk through the house without stopping to catch her breath. No chest pain. She ultimately decided to summon EMS. They reported that her initial SaO2 values to be in the low to mid 80% range. She was placed on 2 L/min of supplemental oxygen and given a SABA updraft in route. When she arrived at the ED, her SaO2 registered 92%. She denies any prior history of asthma or COPD. No ischemic or valvular heart disease. No history of CHF. No orthopnea. No pedal edema. No high fever. Of note, she completed her second COVID19 vaccination approximately 10 days prior to onset of her chief symptoms as described. In the ED, her chest x-ray was felt to show no evidence of acute cardiopulmonary disease. Her d-dimer was normal. However, a CTA of the chest revealed extensive centrilobular ground-glass nodularity throughout the lungs. No pulmonary embolus or signs of right heart strain. Patient admitted with atypical pneumonia/pneumonitis and associated dyspnea, cough and hypoxemia. ASSESSMENT: 71-year-old T2 diabetic with hypertension presents with increasing shortness of breath and nonproductive cough, onset approximately 10 days post second COVID-19 vaccination. CTA of chest reveals an atypical pattern of extensive centrilobular ground glass nodularity. Clinically she has associated mild bronchospasm and hypoxemia.

Anaphylactic reaction; Blood pressure high; Could not breathe; Pain in his arm; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of ANAPHYLACTIC REACTION (Anaphylactic reaction), HYPERTENSION (Blood pressure high) and DYSPNOEA (Could not breathe) in a 71-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 0031b21a) for COVID-19 immunisation. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included COPD. Concurrent medical conditions included Allergy (receives four shots a week for his allergies). On 02-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 02-Apr-2021, the patient experienced PAIN IN EXTREMITY (Pain in his arm). On 05-Apr-2021, the patient experienced DYSPNOEA (Could not breathe) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). On 06-Apr-2021, the patient experienced ANAPHYLACTIC REACTION (Anaphylactic reaction) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and HYPERTENSION (Blood pressure high) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). The patient was hospitalized on 06-Apr-2021 due to ANAPHYLACTIC REACTION, DYSPNOEA and HYPERTENSION. At the time of the report, ANAPHYLACTIC REACTION (Anaphylactic reaction), HYPERTENSION (Blood pressure high), DYSPNOEA (Could not breathe) and PAIN IN EXTREMITY (Pain in his arm) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. No concomitant medications were reported. Treatment of the events included steroids and blood pressure medication. Additional information:Patient stated he had some pain in his arm. Patient states on 4-5-2021 he could not breathe. Patient states on 4-6-2021 he went to emergency room. Patient stated he was in the intensive care unit for 3 days. Patient stated he was given steroids and blood pressure medicine because his blood pressure was high. Patient stated he was told he had an anaphylactic reaction. Patient stated that the doctor thought it was something he ate. Patient state he has a history of COPD and allergies and receives four shots a week for his allergies. Patient stated he will get itching around his mouth from eating chicken but doesn't believe his symptoms was from food. Atypical pneumonia; Patient admitted with atypical pneumonia/pneumonitis; Bronchospasm; Initial SaO2 values to be in the low to mid 80% range; Cough; Hypoxia; Increasing shortness of breath; This case was received via FDA VAERS (Reference number: 1106702) on 27-Apr-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 27-Apr-2021. This regulatory authority case was reported by an other health care professional (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of ATYPICAL PNEUMONIA (Atypical pneumonia), PNEUMONITIS (Patient admitted with atypical pneumonia/pneumonitis), BRONCHOSPASM (Bronchospasm), OXYGEN SATURATION DECREASED (Initial SaO2 values to be in the low to mid 80% range), COUGH (Cough), HYPOXIA (Hypoxia) and DYSPNOEA (Increasing shortness of breath) in a 71-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 012A21A) for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's past medical history included Obesity, Type II obese diabetic since an unknown date, Arterial hypertension, Dyslipidemia since an unknown date, Anxiety disorder since an unknown date and Endometrial cancer. Concomitant products included CLONAZEPAM, ZOLPIDEM, ESCITALOPRAM and AMLODIPINE BESILATE (NORVASC) for an unknown indication. On 03-Mar-2021, the patient received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 15-Mar-2021, the patient experienced ATYPICAL PNEUMONIA (Atypical pneumonia) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), PNEUMONITIS (Patient admitted with atypical pneumonia/pneumonitis) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), BRONCHOSPASM (Bronchospasm) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), OXYGEN SATURATION DECREASED (Initial SaO2 values to be in the low to mid 80% range) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), COUGH (Cough) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), HYPOXIA (Hypoxia) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and DYSPNOEA (Increasing shortness of breath) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). The patient was hospitalized on 15-Mar-2021 due to ATYPICAL PNEUMONIA, BRONCHOSPASM, COUGH, DYSPNOEA, HYPOXIA, OXYGEN SATURATION DECREASED and PNEUMONITIS. At the time of the report, ATYPICAL PNEUMONIA (Atypical pneumonia), PNEUMONITIS (Patient admitted with atypical pneumonia/pneumonitis), BRONCHOSPASM (Bronchospasm), OXYGEN SATURATION DECREASED (Initial SaO2 values to be in the low to mid 80% range), COUGH (Cough), HYPOXIA (Hypoxia) and DYSPNOEA (Increasing shortness of breath) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 15-Mar-2021, Alanine aminotransferase: normal (normal) 53. On 15-Mar-2021, Albumin globulin ratio: normal (normal) 1.1. On 15-Mar-2021, Angiogram: normal (normal) No pulmonary embolus or signs of right heart strain. No thoracic aortic aneurysm or dissection. No enlarged supraclavicular or axillary lymph nodes.. On 15-Mar-2021, Aspartate aminotransferase: normal (normal) 18. On 15-Mar-2021, Blood albumin: normal (normal) 3.9 mg/dl. On 15-Mar-2021, Blood alkaline phosphatase: normal (normal) 74. On 15-Mar-2021, Blood bilirubin: normal (normal) 0.8 mg/dl. On 15-Mar-2021, Blood calcium: normal (normal) 9.1 mg/dl. On 15-Mar-2021, Blood chloride: normal (normal) 105 mEq/L. On 15-Mar-2021, Blood creatinine: 0.7 (normal) normal. On 15-Mar-2021, Blood glucose: 146 (High) high. On 15-Mar-2021, Blood potassium: normal (normal) 3.5 mEq/L. No treatment information mentioned. The patient received both scheduled doses of mRNA-1273 prior to the events, therefore action taken with the drug in response to the events was not applicable. 72 2021-02-28 shortness of breath within a minute of each other the nurse gave 2 full doses of vaccine; hard time breathing; lighthead... Read more
Close
within a minute of each other the nurse gave 2 full doses of vaccine; hard time breathing; lightheadedness; tinnitus, ringing in ears; redness on left arm; headache; A spontaneous report was received from a relative concerning a 72-year old, female patient who received both Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) doses within a minute of each other and experienced having a hard time breathing, headache, redness on left arm, lightheadedness, and tinnitus- ringing in ears. The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. On 14 Feb 2021, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch number: 011M20A) intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. Within one minute, the nurse gave her the second dose of mRNA-1273 (Batch number not provided). The patient had a hard time breathing, bad headache, large redness on left arm, lightheadedness, and tinnitus (ringing in ears). The patient took ibuprofen (400 mg) on 14 Feb 2021 and 15 Feb 2021. On 16 Feb 2021, the patient took Advil (200 mg). The patient received both scheduled doses of mRNA-1273; therefore, action taken with the drug in response to the event is not applicable. The outcome of the event, within a minute of each other the nurse gave 2 full doses of vaccine, was considered resolved on 14 Feb 2021. The outcomes of the events: hard time breathing, redness on left arm, lightheadedness, tinnitus-ringing in ears, and headache is unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA. No other vaccines given same time. Within 15- 20 minutes of receiving injection, the back of my tongue & back of throat were burning & tingling. Within 30 minutes more of my throat was tight, more of my face was tingling & swelling. Home by 45-50 minutes after injection. By then my whole face, neck, throat, was tight & swollen. I was having trouble swallowing & red raised itchy rash all over my body. I Took 100 mgm benedryl by mouth as soon as I got home. I also had my epipen available. Within an hour of taking benedryl it began to reverse the effects. I took another 100 mgm of benedryl 4 hrs later. At bedtime I felt wiped out but better. Throat very faw for. Couple of days.

Within 15 minutes of injection, back if throat & back of tongue began to tingle & burn. I could feel my whole face & throat tightening up. Began to have swallowing difficulty. I was getting a woozie feeling within 30 minutes. I took 100mgm benedryl by mouth w about a pint of water. For the next 50-60 minutes, the tightness continued as far as below my collar bones face very tight swollen. Red raised itchy rash started all over my body. Had epipen in hand as well as stat dose of prednisone to take if necessary. (I have an allergic reaction protocol in hand from my doc for these cases. Transport to ER is always there if needed) . Took about an hour for the benedryl to start countering the adverse affect. Took another 100 mgm at the 4 hr post injection time mark. By bedtime about 10pm, I felt very fatigued, throat & back of tongue very sore & raw feeling.

breathing problem; high blood pressure; severe headaches; A spontaneous report was received from a 72-year-old female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced events breathing problem, high blood pressure and severe headaches. The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. On 03-Feb-2021, prior to the onset of the events the patient received the first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot/batch: 010M-A (unknown numbers between M and A)) intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 10-MAR-2021, 1 month 7 days after receiving the vaccine, the patient reported a breathing problem which lasted for two weeks. The patient also experienced high blood pressure and severe headaches. The patient's physician contraindicated the patient to have the second dose. No treatment information was provided. The seriousness criteria for the event breathing problem was considered as medically significant. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was unknown. The outcome of events, breathing problem was recovered/ resolved and the action taken for high blood pressure, severe headaches was unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and lack of clear temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship was assessed as unlikely related.

Close
3 days after the vaccine: Spastic Diarrhea (2 episodes). Shortness of breath. Loss of balance. Loss of appetite. Very low energy. Foggy brain, constant ringing in the ears: constant "pressure cooker". Yesterday, visited my generalist's who said they have had several cases with similar symptoms.
